metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15658 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The code for downloading files did not properly take care of specialcharacters, which led to an attacker being able to cut off the file endingat an earlier position, leading to a different file type being downloadedthan shown in the dialog. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1,Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15658` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
